comments.body: Great work on consolidating this kind of sets.
Will we have any race issue here? Do we do a guard to make sure `total_slots - used_slots` is always larger or equal than 0?

Yes we may have race issue and other cases causing the result to be negative( e.g. force triggered backfills). Right now the usage of this method does check the result using `<= 0` so even if we got negative returns we're fine. And logically I think it makes more sense to return negative values if we're overwhelming the pool. What do you think?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +47,51 @@            TI.pool == Pool.default_pool_name).filter(
            TI.state.in_([State.RUNNING, State.QUEUED])).scalar()
        return total_slots - used_slots

    def to_json(self):

comments.body: Before the [change removing this code](https://github.com/apache/airflow/commit/d63b6c9a5d3f8dfcb959daf93dd55dcb710d0e38), the open slots was calculated as slots - used_slots - queued_slots. Should we also restore it like that?
used_slot already include both tasks in running state and queued state. So no need to minus the queued slots.

I think it still is? used_slots was State.RUNNING, and queued_slots was State.QUEUED.

So now its `slots - (count RUNNING or QUEUED)` = `slots - RUNNING - QUEUED` (just via one query than two).

I think. It's been a long day.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +100,104 @@        used_slots = session.query(func.count()).filter(TI.pool == self.pool).filter(
            TI.state.in_([State.RUNNING, State.QUEUED])).scalar()
        return self.slots - used_slots
